content.question: An object is initially at rest at the origin of the <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. A single conservative force is exerted on the object. The force <math alttext="F sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of position <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the graph provided. Which of the following sets of graphs best show the potential energy of the system and the kinetic energy of the object as the object moves away from the origin?

choices.label: The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. In the first graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled K. The line begins at origin and moves diagonally upwards and to the right. In the second graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled U sub g. The line begins at origin and moves diagonally upwards and to the right.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane with origin labeled O. In the first graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled K. The line begins at origin and moves diagonally upwards and to the right. In the second graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled U sub g. The line begins near top of the vertical axis above the origin and moves diagonally downwards and to the right.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. In the first graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled K. The line begins at origin and curves diagonally upwards and to the right at an increasing rate. In the second graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled U sub g. The line begins at origin and curves diagonally upwards and to the right at an increasing rate.

The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. In the first graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled K. The line begins at origin and curves upwards and to the right at an increasing rate. In the second graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled U sub g. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and curves downwards and to the right at an increasing rate, ending when it reaches the x axis.

The figure presents two graphs of curve and a line in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. In the first graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled K, and origin 0. The line begins at origin and curves upwards and to the right at an increasing rate. In the second graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled U sub g, and origin 0. The line begins at origin and extends diagonally upwards and to the right until the end of the graph.

content.answer: The figure presents two graphs in the first quadrant of the coordinate plane. In the first graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x and the vertical axis is labeled K. The line begins at origin and curves upwards and to the right at an increasing rate. In the second graph, the horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled U sub g. The line begins near the top of the vertical axis above the origin and curves downwards and to the right at an increasing rate, ending when it reaches the x axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
